088/**
089 * Basic test of BucketCache.Puts and gets.
090 * <p>
091 * Tests will ensure that blocks' data correctness under several threads concurrency
092 */
093@RunWith(Parameterized.class)
094@Category({ IOTests.class, LargeTests.class })
095public class TestBucketCache {
096
097  private static final Logger LOG = LoggerFactory.getLogger(TestBucketCache.class);
098
099  @ClassRule
100  public static final HBaseClassTestRule CLASS_RULE =
101    HBaseClassTestRule.forClass(TestBucketCache.class);
102
103  @Parameterized.Parameters(name = "{index}: blockSize={0}, bucketSizes={1}")
104  public static Iterable<Object[]> data() {
105    return Arrays.asList(new Object[][] { { 8192, null }, // TODO: why is 8k the default blocksize
106                                                          // for these tests?
107      { 16 * 1024,
108        new int[] { 2 * 1024 + 1024, 4 * 1024 + 1024, 8 * 1024 + 1024, 16 * 1024 + 1024,
109          28 * 1024 + 1024, 32 * 1024 + 1024, 64 * 1024 + 1024, 96 * 1024 + 1024,
110          128 * 1024 + 1024 } } });
111  }
112
113  @Parameterized.Parameter(0)
114  public int constructedBlockSize;
115
116  @Parameterized.Parameter(1)
117  public int[] constructedBlockSizes;
118
119  BucketCache cache;
120  final int CACHE_SIZE = 1000000;
121  final int NUM_BLOCKS = 100;
122  final int BLOCK_SIZE = CACHE_SIZE / NUM_BLOCKS;
123  final int NUM_THREADS = 100;
124  final int NUM_QUERIES = 10000;
125
126  final long capacitySize = 32 * 1024 * 1024;
127  final int writeThreads = BucketCache.DEFAULT_WRITER_THREADS;
128  final int writerQLen = BucketCache.DEFAULT_WRITER_QUEUE_ITEMS;
129  private String ioEngineName = "offheap";

133  private static class MockedBucketCache extends BucketCache {
134
135    public MockedBucketCache(String ioEngineName, long capacity, int blockSize, int[] bucketSizes,
136      int writerThreads, int writerQLen, String persistencePath) throws IOException {
137      super(ioEngineName, capacity, blockSize, bucketSizes, writerThreads, writerQLen,
138        persistencePath);
139    }
140
141    @Override
142    public void cacheBlock(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, Cacheable buf, boolean inMemory) {
143      super.cacheBlock(cacheKey, buf, inMemory);
144    }
145
146    @Override
147    public void cacheBlock(BlockCacheKey cacheKey, Cacheable buf) {
148      super.cacheBlock(cacheKey, buf);
149    }
150  }

152  @Before
153  public void setup() throws IOException {
154    cache = new MockedBucketCache(ioEngineName, capacitySize, constructedBlockSize,
155      constructedBlockSizes, writeThreads, writerQLen, null);
156  }

158  @After
159  public void tearDown() {
160    cache.shutdown();
161  }

163  /**
164   * Test Utility to create test dir and return name
165   * @return return name of created dir
166   * @throws IOException throws IOException
167   */
168  private Path createAndGetTestDir() throws IOException {
169    final Path testDir = HBASE_TESTING_UTILITY.getDataTestDir();
170    HBASE_TESTING_UTILITY.getTestFileSystem().mkdirs(testDir);
171    return testDir;
172  }
173
174  /**
175   * Return a random element from {@code a}.
176   */
177  private static <T> T randFrom(List<T> a) {
178    return a.get(ThreadLocalRandom.current().nextInt(a.size()));
179  }
180
181  @Test
182  public void testBucketAllocator() throws BucketAllocatorException {
183    BucketAllocator mAllocator = cache.getAllocator();
184    /*
185     * Test the allocator first
186     */
187    final List<Integer> BLOCKSIZES = Arrays.asList(4 * 1024, 8 * 1024, 64 * 1024, 96 * 1024);
188
189    boolean full = false;
190    ArrayList<Pair<Long, Integer>> allocations = new ArrayList<>();
191    // Fill the allocated extents by choosing a random blocksize. Continues selecting blocks until
192    // the cache is completely filled.
193    List<Integer> tmp = new ArrayList<>(BLOCKSIZES);
194    while (!full) {
195      Integer blockSize = null;
196      try {
197        blockSize = randFrom(tmp);
198        allocations.add(new Pair<>(mAllocator.allocateBlock(blockSize), blockSize));
199      } catch (CacheFullException cfe) {
200        tmp.remove(blockSize);
201        if (tmp.isEmpty()) full = true;
202      }
203    }
204
205    for (Integer blockSize : BLOCKSIZES) {
206      BucketSizeInfo bucketSizeInfo = mAllocator.roundUpToBucketSizeInfo(blockSize);
207      IndexStatistics indexStatistics = bucketSizeInfo.statistics();
208      assertEquals("unexpected freeCount for " + bucketSizeInfo, 0, indexStatistics.freeCount());
209
210      // we know the block sizes above are multiples of 1024, but default bucket sizes give an
211      // additional 1024 on top of that so this counts towards fragmentation in our test
212      // real life may have worse fragmentation because blocks may not be perfectly sized to block
213      // size, given encoding/compression and large rows
214      assertEquals(1024 * indexStatistics.totalCount(), indexStatistics.fragmentationBytes());
215    }
216
217    mAllocator.logDebugStatistics();
218
219    for (Pair<Long, Integer> allocation : allocations) {
220      assertEquals(mAllocator.sizeOfAllocation(allocation.getFirst()),
221        mAllocator.freeBlock(allocation.getFirst(), allocation.getSecond()));
222    }
223    assertEquals(0, mAllocator.getUsedSize());
224  }
225
226  @Test
227  public void testCacheSimple() throws Exception {
228    CacheTestUtils.testCacheSimple(cache, BLOCK_SIZE, NUM_QUERIES);
229  }
230
231  @Test
232  public void testCacheMultiThreadedSingleKey() throws Exception {
233    CacheTestUtils.hammerSingleKey(cache, 2 * NUM_THREADS, 2 * NUM_QUERIES);
234  }
235
236  @Test
237  public void testHeapSizeChanges() throws Exception {
238    cache.stopWriterThreads();
239    CacheTestUtils.testHeapSizeChanges(cache, BLOCK_SIZE);
240  }
241
242  public static void waitUntilFlushedToBucket(BucketCache cache, BlockCacheKey cacheKey)
243    throws InterruptedException {
244    Waiter.waitFor(HBaseConfiguration.create(), 10000,
245      () -> (cache.backingMap.containsKey(cacheKey) && !cache.ramCache.containsKey(cacheKey)));
246  }
247
248  public static void waitUntilAllFlushedToBucket(BucketCache cache) throws InterruptedException {
249    while (!cache.ramCache.isEmpty()) {
250      Thread.sleep(100);
251    }
252    Thread.sleep(1000);
253  }
254
255  // BucketCache.cacheBlock is async, it first adds block to ramCache and writeQueue, then writer
256  // threads will flush it to the bucket and put reference entry in backingMap.
257  private void cacheAndWaitUntilFlushedToBucket(BucketCache cache, BlockCacheKey cacheKey,
258    Cacheable block, boolean waitWhenCache) throws InterruptedException {
259    cache.cacheBlock(cacheKey, block, false, waitWhenCache);
260    waitUntilFlushedToBucket(cache, cacheKey);
261  }
262
263  @Test
264  public void testMemoryLeak() throws Exception {
265    final BlockCacheKey cacheKey = new BlockCacheKey("dummy", 1L);
266    cacheAndWaitUntilFlushedToBucket(cache, cacheKey,
267      new CacheTestUtils.ByteArrayCacheable(new byte[10]), true);
268    long lockId = cache.backingMap.get(cacheKey).offset();
269    ReentrantReadWriteLock lock = cache.offsetLock.getLock(lockId);
270    lock.writeLock().lock();
271    Thread evictThread = new Thread("evict-block") {
272      @Override
273      public void run() {
274        cache.evictBlock(cacheKey);
275      }
276    };
277    evictThread.start();
278    cache.offsetLock.waitForWaiters(lockId, 1);
279    cache.blockEvicted(cacheKey, cache.backingMap.remove(cacheKey), true, true);
280    assertEquals(0, cache.getBlockCount());
281    cacheAndWaitUntilFlushedToBucket(cache, cacheKey,
282      new CacheTestUtils.ByteArrayCacheable(new byte[10]), true);
283    assertEquals(1, cache.getBlockCount());
284    lock.writeLock().unlock();
285    evictThread.join();
286    /**
287     * <pre>
288     * The asserts here before HBASE-21957 are:
289     * assertEquals(1L, cache.getBlockCount());
290     * assertTrue(cache.getCurrentSize() > 0L);
291     * assertTrue("We should have a block!", cache.iterator().hasNext());
292     *
293     * The asserts here after HBASE-21957 are:
294     * assertEquals(0, cache.getBlockCount());
295     * assertEquals(cache.getCurrentSize(), 0L);
296     *
297     * I think the asserts before HBASE-21957 is more reasonable,because
298     * {@link BucketCache#evictBlock} should only evict the {@link BucketEntry}
299     * it had seen, and newly added Block after the {@link BucketEntry}
300     * it had seen should not be evicted.
301     * </pre>
302     */
303    assertEquals(1L, cache.getBlockCount());
304    assertTrue(cache.getCurrentSize() > 0L);
305    assertTrue("We should have a block!", cache.iterator().hasNext());
306  }
307
308  @Test
309  public void testRetrieveFromFile() throws Exception {
310    Path testDir = createAndGetTestDir();
311    String ioEngineName = "file:" + testDir + "/bucket.cache";
312    testRetrievalUtils(testDir, ioEngineName);
313    int[] smallBucketSizes = new int[] { 3 * 1024, 5 * 1024 };
314    String persistencePath = testDir + "/bucket.persistence";
315    BucketCache bucketCache = null;
316    try {
317      bucketCache = new BucketCache(ioEngineName, capacitySize, constructedBlockSize,
318        smallBucketSizes, writeThreads, writerQLen, persistencePath);
319      assertTrue(bucketCache.waitForCacheInitialization(10000));
320      assertFalse(new File(persistencePath).exists());
321      assertEquals(0, bucketCache.getAllocator().getUsedSize());
322      assertEquals(0, bucketCache.backingMap.size());
323    } finally {
324      bucketCache.shutdown();
325      HBASE_TESTING_UTILITY.cleanupTestDir();
326    }
327  }
328
329  @Test
330  public void testRetrieveFromMMap() throws Exception {
331    final Path testDir = createAndGetTestDir();
332    final String ioEngineName = "mmap:" + testDir + "/bucket.cache";
333    testRetrievalUtils(testDir, ioEngineName);
334  }
335
336  @Test
337  public void testRetrieveFromPMem() throws Exception {
338    final Path testDir = createAndGetTestDir();
339    final String ioEngineName = "pmem:" + testDir + "/bucket.cache";
340    testRetrievalUtils(testDir, ioEngineName);
341    int[] smallBucketSizes = new int[] { 3 * 1024, 5 * 1024 };
342    String persistencePath = testDir + "/bucket.persistence" + EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
343    BucketCache bucketCache = null;
344    try {
345      bucketCache = new BucketCache(ioEngineName, capacitySize, constructedBlockSize,
346        smallBucketSizes, writeThreads, writerQLen, persistencePath);
347      assertTrue(bucketCache.waitForCacheInitialization(10000));
348      assertFalse(new File(persistencePath).exists());
349      assertEquals(0, bucketCache.getAllocator().getUsedSize());
350      assertEquals(0, bucketCache.backingMap.size());
351    } finally {
352      bucketCache.shutdown();
353      HBASE_TESTING_UTILITY.cleanupTestDir();
354    }
355  }
356
357  private void testRetrievalUtils(Path testDir, String ioEngineName)
358    throws IOException, InterruptedException {
359    final String persistencePath =
360      testDir + "/bucket.persistence" + EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
361    BucketCache bucketCache = null;
362    try {
363      bucketCache = new BucketCache(ioEngineName, capacitySize, constructedBlockSize,
364        constructedBlockSizes, writeThreads, writerQLen, persistencePath);
365      assertTrue(bucketCache.waitForCacheInitialization(10000));
366      long usedSize = bucketCache.getAllocator().getUsedSize();
367      assertEquals(0, usedSize);
368      HFileBlockPair[] blocks = CacheTestUtils.generateHFileBlocks(constructedBlockSize, 1);
369      for (HFileBlockPair block : blocks) {
370        bucketCache.cacheBlock(block.getBlockName(), block.getBlock());
371      }
372      for (HFileBlockPair block : blocks) {
373        cacheAndWaitUntilFlushedToBucket(bucketCache, block.getBlockName(), block.getBlock(),
374          false);
375      }
376      usedSize = bucketCache.getAllocator().getUsedSize();
377      assertNotEquals(0, usedSize);
378      bucketCache.shutdown();
379      assertTrue(new File(persistencePath).exists());
380      bucketCache = new BucketCache(ioEngineName, capacitySize, constructedBlockSize,
381        constructedBlockSizes, writeThreads, writerQLen, persistencePath);
382      assertTrue(bucketCache.waitForCacheInitialization(10000));
383
384      assertEquals(usedSize, bucketCache.getAllocator().getUsedSize());
385    } finally {
386      if (bucketCache != null) {
387        bucketCache.shutdown();
388      }
389    }
390    assertTrue(new File(persistencePath).exists());
391  }
392
393  @Test
394  public void testRetrieveUnsupportedIOE() throws Exception {
395    try {
396      final Path testDir = createAndGetTestDir();
397      final String ioEngineName = testDir + "/bucket.cache";
398      testRetrievalUtils(testDir, ioEngineName);
399      Assert.fail("Should have thrown IllegalArgumentException because of unsupported IOEngine!!");
400    } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
401      Assert.assertEquals("Don't understand io engine name for cache- prefix with file:, "
402        + "files:, mmap: or offheap", e.getMessage());
403    }
404  }
405
406  @Test
407  public void testRetrieveFromMultipleFiles() throws Exception {
408    final Path testDirInitial = createAndGetTestDir();
409    final Path newTestDir = new HBaseTestingUtil().getDataTestDir();
410    HBASE_TESTING_UTILITY.getTestFileSystem().mkdirs(newTestDir);
411    String ioEngineName =
412      new StringBuilder("files:").append(testDirInitial).append("/bucket1.cache")
413        .append(FileIOEngine.FILE_DELIMITER).append(newTestDir).append("/bucket2.cache").toString();
414    testRetrievalUtils(testDirInitial, ioEngineName);
415    int[] smallBucketSizes = new int[] { 3 * 1024, 5 * 1024 };
416    String persistencePath = testDirInitial + "/bucket.persistence";
417    BucketCache bucketCache = null;
418    try {
419      bucketCache = new BucketCache(ioEngineName, capacitySize, constructedBlockSize,
420        smallBucketSizes, writeThreads, writerQLen, persistencePath);
421      assertTrue(bucketCache.waitForCacheInitialization(10000));
422      assertFalse(new File(persistencePath).exists());
423      assertEquals(0, bucketCache.getAllocator().getUsedSize());
424      assertEquals(0, bucketCache.backingMap.size());
425    } finally {
426      bucketCache.shutdown();
427      HBASE_TESTING_UTILITY.cleanupTestDir();
428    }
429  }
430
431  @Test
432  public void testRetrieveFromFileWithoutPersistence() throws Exception {
433    BucketCache bucketCache = new BucketCache(ioEngineName, capacitySize, constructedBlockSize,
434      constructedBlockSizes, writeThreads, writerQLen, null);
435    assertTrue(bucketCache.waitForCacheInitialization(10000));
436    try {
437      final Path testDir = createAndGetTestDir();
438      String ioEngineName = "file:" + testDir + "/bucket.cache";
439      long usedSize = bucketCache.getAllocator().getUsedSize();
440      assertEquals(0, usedSize);
441      HFileBlockPair[] blocks = CacheTestUtils.generateHFileBlocks(constructedBlockSize, 1);
442      for (HFileBlockPair block : blocks) {
443        bucketCache.cacheBlock(block.getBlockName(), block.getBlock());
444      }
445      for (HFileBlockPair block : blocks) {
446        cacheAndWaitUntilFlushedToBucket(bucketCache, block.getBlockName(), block.getBlock(),
447          false);
448      }
449      usedSize = bucketCache.getAllocator().getUsedSize();
450      assertNotEquals(0, usedSize);
451      bucketCache.shutdown();
452      bucketCache = new BucketCache(ioEngineName, capacitySize, constructedBlockSize,
453        constructedBlockSizes, writeThreads, writerQLen, null);
454      assertTrue(bucketCache.waitForCacheInitialization(10000));
455      assertEquals(0, bucketCache.getAllocator().getUsedSize());
456    } finally {
457      bucketCache.shutdown();
458      HBASE_TESTING_UTILITY.cleanupTestDir();
459    }
460  }

462  @Test
463  public void testBucketAllocatorLargeBuckets() throws BucketAllocatorException {
464    long availableSpace = 20 * 1024L * 1024 * 1024;
465    int[] bucketSizes = new int[] { 1024, 1024 * 1024, 1024 * 1024 * 1024 };
466    BucketAllocator allocator = new BucketAllocator(availableSpace, bucketSizes);
467    assertTrue(allocator.getBuckets().length > 0);
468  }

470  @Test
471  public void testGetPartitionSize() throws IOException {
472    // Test default values
473    validateGetPartitionSize(cache, BucketCache.DEFAULT_SINGLE_FACTOR,
474      BucketCache.DEFAULT_MIN_FACTOR);
475
476    Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();
477    conf.setFloat(MIN_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, 0.5f);
478    conf.setFloat(BucketCache.SINGLE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, 0.1f);
479    conf.setFloat(BucketCache.MULTI_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, 0.7f);
480    conf.setFloat(BucketCache.MEMORY_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, 0.2f);
481
482    BucketCache cache = new BucketCache(ioEngineName, capacitySize, constructedBlockSize,
483      constructedBlockSizes, writeThreads, writerQLen, null, 100, conf);
484    assertTrue(cache.waitForCacheInitialization(10000));
485
486    validateGetPartitionSize(cache, 0.1f, 0.5f);
487    validateGetPartitionSize(cache, 0.7f, 0.5f);
488    validateGetPartitionSize(cache, 0.2f, 0.5f);
489  }
490
491  @Test
492  public void testCacheSizeCapacity() throws IOException {
493    // Test cache capacity (capacity / blockSize) < Integer.MAX_VALUE
494    validateGetPartitionSize(cache, BucketCache.DEFAULT_SINGLE_FACTOR,
495      BucketCache.DEFAULT_MIN_FACTOR);
496    Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();
497    conf.setFloat(BucketCache.MIN_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, 0.5f);
498    conf.setFloat(BucketCache.SINGLE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, 0.1f);
499    conf.setFloat(BucketCache.MULTI_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, 0.7f);
500    conf.setFloat(BucketCache.MEMORY_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, 0.2f);
501    try {
502      new BucketCache(ioEngineName, Long.MAX_VALUE, 1, constructedBlockSizes, writeThreads,
503        writerQLen, null, 100, conf);
504      Assert.fail("Should have thrown IllegalArgumentException because of large cache capacity!");
505    } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
506      Assert.assertEquals("Cache capacity is too large, only support 32TB now", e.getMessage());
507    }
508  }
509
510  @Test
511  public void testValidBucketCacheConfigs() throws IOException {
512    Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();
513    conf.setFloat(ACCEPT_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, 0.9f);
514    conf.setFloat(MIN_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, 0.5f);
515    conf.setFloat(EXTRA_FREE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, 0.5f);
516    conf.setFloat(BucketCache.SINGLE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, 0.1f);
517    conf.setFloat(BucketCache.MULTI_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, 0.7f);
518    conf.setFloat(BucketCache.MEMORY_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, 0.2f);
519
520    BucketCache cache = new BucketCache(ioEngineName, capacitySize, constructedBlockSize,
521      constructedBlockSizes, writeThreads, writerQLen, null, 100, conf);
522    assertTrue(cache.waitForCacheInitialization(10000));
523
524    assertEquals(ACCEPT_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " failed to propagate.", 0.9f,
525      cache.getAcceptableFactor(), 0);
526    assertEquals(MIN_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " failed to propagate.", 0.5f, cache.getMinFactor(), 0);
527    assertEquals(EXTRA_FREE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " failed to propagate.", 0.5f,
528      cache.getExtraFreeFactor(), 0);
529    assertEquals(BucketCache.SINGLE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " failed to propagate.", 0.1f,
530      cache.getSingleFactor(), 0);
531    assertEquals(BucketCache.MULTI_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " failed to propagate.", 0.7f,
532      cache.getMultiFactor(), 0);
533    assertEquals(BucketCache.MEMORY_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME + " failed to propagate.", 0.2f,
534      cache.getMemoryFactor(), 0);
535  }
536
537  @Test
538  public void testInvalidAcceptFactorConfig() throws IOException {
539    float[] configValues = { -1f, 0.2f, 0.86f, 1.05f };
540    boolean[] expectedOutcomes = { false, false, true, false };
541    Map<String, float[]> configMappings = ImmutableMap.of(ACCEPT_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, configValues);
542    Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();
543    checkConfigValues(conf, configMappings, expectedOutcomes);
544  }
545
546  @Test
547  public void testInvalidMinFactorConfig() throws IOException {
548    float[] configValues = { -1f, 0f, 0.96f, 1.05f };
549    // throws due to <0, in expected range, minFactor > acceptableFactor, > 1.0
550    boolean[] expectedOutcomes = { false, true, false, false };
551    Map<String, float[]> configMappings = ImmutableMap.of(MIN_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, configValues);
552    Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();
553    checkConfigValues(conf, configMappings, expectedOutcomes);
554  }
555
556  @Test
557  public void testInvalidExtraFreeFactorConfig() throws IOException {
558    float[] configValues = { -1f, 0f, 0.2f, 1.05f };
559    // throws due to <0, in expected range, in expected range, config can be > 1.0
560    boolean[] expectedOutcomes = { false, true, true, true };
561    Map<String, float[]> configMappings =
562      ImmutableMap.of(EXTRA_FREE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, configValues);
563    Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();
564    checkConfigValues(conf, configMappings, expectedOutcomes);
565  }
566
567  @Test
568  public void testInvalidCacheSplitFactorConfig() throws IOException {
569    float[] singleFactorConfigValues = { 0.2f, 0f, -0.2f, 1f };
570    float[] multiFactorConfigValues = { 0.4f, 0f, 1f, .05f };
571    float[] memoryFactorConfigValues = { 0.4f, 0f, 0.2f, .5f };
572    // All configs add up to 1.0 and are between 0 and 1.0, configs don't add to 1.0, configs can't
573    // be negative, configs don't add to 1.0
574    boolean[] expectedOutcomes = { true, false, false, false };
575    Map<String,
576      float[]> configMappings = ImmutableMap.of(BucketCache.SINGLE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME,
577        singleFactorConfigValues, BucketCache.MULTI_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, multiFactorConfigValues,
578        BucketCache.MEMORY_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, memoryFactorConfigValues);
579    Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();
580    checkConfigValues(conf, configMappings, expectedOutcomes);
581  }
582
583  private void checkConfigValues(Configuration conf, Map<String, float[]> configMap,
584    boolean[] expectSuccess) throws IOException {
585    Set<String> configNames = configMap.keySet();
586    for (int i = 0; i < expectSuccess.length; i++) {
587      try {
588        for (String configName : configNames) {
589          conf.setFloat(configName, configMap.get(configName)[i]);
590        }
591        BucketCache cache = new BucketCache(ioEngineName, capacitySize, constructedBlockSize,
592          constructedBlockSizes, writeThreads, writerQLen, null, 100, conf);
593        assertTrue(cache.waitForCacheInitialization(10000));
594        assertTrue("Created BucketCache and expected it to succeed: " + expectSuccess[i]
595          + ", but it actually was: " + !expectSuccess[i], expectSuccess[i]);
596      } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
597        assertFalse("Created BucketCache and expected it to succeed: " + expectSuccess[i]
598          + ", but it actually was: " + !expectSuccess[i], expectSuccess[i]);
599      }
600    }
601  }
602
603  private void validateGetPartitionSize(BucketCache bucketCache, float partitionFactor,
604    float minFactor) {
605    long expectedOutput =
606      (long) Math.floor(bucketCache.getAllocator().getTotalSize() * partitionFactor * minFactor);
607    assertEquals(expectedOutput, bucketCache.getPartitionSize(partitionFactor));
608  }
609
610  @Test
611  public void testOffsetProducesPositiveOutput() {
612    // This number is picked because it produces negative output if the values isn't ensured to be
613    // positive. See HBASE-18757 for more information.
614    long testValue = 549888460800L;
615    BucketEntry bucketEntry = new BucketEntry(testValue, 10, 10, 10L, true, (entry) -> {
616      return ByteBuffAllocator.NONE;
617    }, ByteBuffAllocator.HEAP);
618    assertEquals(testValue, bucketEntry.offset());
619  }
620
621  @Test
622  public void testEvictionCount() throws InterruptedException {
623    int size = 100;
624    int length = HConstants.HFILEBLOCK_HEADER_SIZE + size;
625    ByteBuffer buf1 = ByteBuffer.allocate(size), buf2 = ByteBuffer.allocate(size);
626    HFileContext meta = new HFileContextBuilder().build();
627    ByteBuffAllocator allocator = ByteBuffAllocator.HEAP;
628    HFileBlock blockWithNextBlockMetadata = new HFileBlock(BlockType.DATA, size, size, -1,
629      ByteBuff.wrap(buf1), HFileBlock.FILL_HEADER, -1, 52, -1, meta, allocator);
630    HFileBlock blockWithoutNextBlockMetadata = new HFileBlock(BlockType.DATA, size, size, -1,
631      ByteBuff.wrap(buf2), HFileBlock.FILL_HEADER, -1, -1, -1, meta, allocator);
632
633    BlockCacheKey key = new BlockCacheKey("testEvictionCount", 0);
634    ByteBuffer actualBuffer = ByteBuffer.allocate(length);
635    ByteBuffer block1Buffer = ByteBuffer.allocate(length);
636    ByteBuffer block2Buffer = ByteBuffer.allocate(length);
637    blockWithNextBlockMetadata.serialize(block1Buffer, true);
638    blockWithoutNextBlockMetadata.serialize(block2Buffer, true);
639
640    // Add blockWithNextBlockMetadata, expect blockWithNextBlockMetadata back.
641    CacheTestUtils.getBlockAndAssertEquals(cache, key, blockWithNextBlockMetadata, actualBuffer,
642      block1Buffer);
643
644    waitUntilFlushedToBucket(cache, key);
645
646    assertEquals(0, cache.getStats().getEvictionCount());
647
648    // evict call should return 1, but then eviction count be 0
649    assertEquals(1, cache.evictBlocksByHfileName("testEvictionCount"));
650    assertEquals(0, cache.getStats().getEvictionCount());
651
652    // add back
653    CacheTestUtils.getBlockAndAssertEquals(cache, key, blockWithNextBlockMetadata, actualBuffer,
654      block1Buffer);
655    waitUntilFlushedToBucket(cache, key);
656
657    // should not increment
658    assertTrue(cache.evictBlock(key));
659    assertEquals(0, cache.getStats().getEvictionCount());
660
661    // add back
662    CacheTestUtils.getBlockAndAssertEquals(cache, key, blockWithNextBlockMetadata, actualBuffer,
663      block1Buffer);
664    waitUntilFlushedToBucket(cache, key);
665
666    // should finally increment eviction count
667    cache.freeSpace("testing");
668    assertEquals(1, cache.getStats().getEvictionCount());
669  }
670
671  @Test
672  public void testCacheBlockNextBlockMetadataMissing() throws Exception {
673    int size = 100;
674    int length = HConstants.HFILEBLOCK_HEADER_SIZE + size;
675    ByteBuffer buf1 = ByteBuffer.allocate(size), buf2 = ByteBuffer.allocate(size);
676    HFileContext meta = new HFileContextBuilder().build();
677    ByteBuffAllocator allocator = ByteBuffAllocator.HEAP;
678    HFileBlock blockWithNextBlockMetadata = new HFileBlock(BlockType.DATA, size, size, -1,
679      ByteBuff.wrap(buf1), HFileBlock.FILL_HEADER, -1, 52, -1, meta, allocator);
680    HFileBlock blockWithoutNextBlockMetadata = new HFileBlock(BlockType.DATA, size, size, -1,
681      ByteBuff.wrap(buf2), HFileBlock.FILL_HEADER, -1, -1, -1, meta, allocator);
682
683    BlockCacheKey key = new BlockCacheKey("testCacheBlockNextBlockMetadataMissing", 0);
684    ByteBuffer actualBuffer = ByteBuffer.allocate(length);
685    ByteBuffer block1Buffer = ByteBuffer.allocate(length);
686    ByteBuffer block2Buffer = ByteBuffer.allocate(length);
687    blockWithNextBlockMetadata.serialize(block1Buffer, true);
688    blockWithoutNextBlockMetadata.serialize(block2Buffer, true);
689
690    // Add blockWithNextBlockMetadata, expect blockWithNextBlockMetadata back.
691    CacheTestUtils.getBlockAndAssertEquals(cache, key, blockWithNextBlockMetadata, actualBuffer,
692      block1Buffer);
693
694    waitUntilFlushedToBucket(cache, key);
695    assertNotNull(cache.backingMap.get(key));
696    assertEquals(1, cache.backingMap.get(key).refCnt());
697    assertEquals(1, blockWithNextBlockMetadata.getBufferReadOnly().refCnt());
698    assertEquals(1, blockWithoutNextBlockMetadata.getBufferReadOnly().refCnt());
699
700    // Add blockWithoutNextBlockMetada, expect blockWithNextBlockMetadata back.
701    CacheTestUtils.getBlockAndAssertEquals(cache, key, blockWithoutNextBlockMetadata, actualBuffer,
702      block1Buffer);
703    assertEquals(1, blockWithNextBlockMetadata.getBufferReadOnly().refCnt());
704    assertEquals(1, blockWithoutNextBlockMetadata.getBufferReadOnly().refCnt());
705    assertEquals(1, cache.backingMap.get(key).refCnt());
706
707    // Clear and add blockWithoutNextBlockMetadata
708    assertTrue(cache.evictBlock(key));
709    assertEquals(1, blockWithNextBlockMetadata.getBufferReadOnly().refCnt());
710    assertEquals(1, blockWithoutNextBlockMetadata.getBufferReadOnly().refCnt());
711
712    assertNull(cache.getBlock(key, false, false, false));
713    CacheTestUtils.getBlockAndAssertEquals(cache, key, blockWithoutNextBlockMetadata, actualBuffer,
714      block2Buffer);
715
716    waitUntilFlushedToBucket(cache, key);
717    assertEquals(1, blockWithNextBlockMetadata.getBufferReadOnly().refCnt());
718    assertEquals(1, blockWithoutNextBlockMetadata.getBufferReadOnly().refCnt());
719
720    // Add blockWithNextBlockMetadata, expect blockWithNextBlockMetadata to replace.
721    CacheTestUtils.getBlockAndAssertEquals(cache, key, blockWithNextBlockMetadata, actualBuffer,
722      block1Buffer);
723
724    waitUntilFlushedToBucket(cache, key);
725    assertEquals(1, blockWithNextBlockMetadata.getBufferReadOnly().refCnt());
726    assertEquals(1, blockWithoutNextBlockMetadata.getBufferReadOnly().refCnt());
727  }
728
729  @Test
730  public void testRAMCache() {
731    int size = 100;
732    int length = HConstants.HFILEBLOCK_HEADER_SIZE + size;
733    byte[] byteArr = new byte[length];
734    ByteBuffer buf = ByteBuffer.wrap(byteArr, 0, size);
735    HFileContext meta = new HFileContextBuilder().build();
736
737    RAMCache cache = new RAMCache();
738    BlockCacheKey key1 = new BlockCacheKey("file-1", 1);
739    BlockCacheKey key2 = new BlockCacheKey("file-2", 2);
740    HFileBlock blk1 = new HFileBlock(BlockType.DATA, size, size, -1, ByteBuff.wrap(buf),
741      HFileBlock.FILL_HEADER, -1, 52, -1, meta, ByteBuffAllocator.HEAP);
742    HFileBlock blk2 = new HFileBlock(BlockType.DATA, size, size, -1, ByteBuff.wrap(buf),
743      HFileBlock.FILL_HEADER, -1, -1, -1, meta, ByteBuffAllocator.HEAP);
744    RAMQueueEntry re1 = new RAMQueueEntry(key1, blk1, 1, false, false);
745    RAMQueueEntry re2 = new RAMQueueEntry(key1, blk2, 1, false, false);
746
747    assertFalse(cache.containsKey(key1));
748    assertNull(cache.putIfAbsent(key1, re1));
749    assertEquals(2, ((HFileBlock) re1.getData()).getBufferReadOnly().refCnt());
750
751    assertNotNull(cache.putIfAbsent(key1, re2));
752    assertEquals(2, ((HFileBlock) re1.getData()).getBufferReadOnly().refCnt());
753    assertEquals(1, ((HFileBlock) re2.getData()).getBufferReadOnly().refCnt());
754
755    assertNull(cache.putIfAbsent(key2, re2));
756    assertEquals(2, ((HFileBlock) re1.getData()).getBufferReadOnly().refCnt());
757    assertEquals(2, ((HFileBlock) re2.getData()).getBufferReadOnly().refCnt());
758
759    cache.remove(key1);
760    assertEquals(1, ((HFileBlock) re1.getData()).getBufferReadOnly().refCnt());
761    assertEquals(2, ((HFileBlock) re2.getData()).getBufferReadOnly().refCnt());
762
763    cache.clear();
764    assertEquals(1, ((HFileBlock) re1.getData()).getBufferReadOnly().refCnt());
765    assertEquals(1, ((HFileBlock) re2.getData()).getBufferReadOnly().refCnt());
766  }
767
768  @Test
769  public void testFreeBlockWhenIOEngineWriteFailure() throws IOException {
770    // initialize an block.
771    int size = 100, offset = 20;
772    int length = HConstants.HFILEBLOCK_HEADER_SIZE + size;
773    ByteBuffer buf = ByteBuffer.allocate(length);
774    HFileContext meta = new HFileContextBuilder().build();
775    HFileBlock block = new HFileBlock(BlockType.DATA, size, size, -1, ByteBuff.wrap(buf),
776      HFileBlock.FILL_HEADER, offset, 52, -1, meta, ByteBuffAllocator.HEAP);
777
778    // initialize an mocked ioengine.
779    IOEngine ioEngine = Mockito.mock(IOEngine.class);
780    when(ioEngine.usesSharedMemory()).thenReturn(false);
781    // Mockito.doNothing().when(ioEngine).write(Mockito.any(ByteBuffer.class), Mockito.anyLong());
782    Mockito.doThrow(RuntimeException.class).when(ioEngine).write(Mockito.any(ByteBuffer.class),
783      Mockito.anyLong());
784    Mockito.doThrow(RuntimeException.class).when(ioEngine).write(Mockito.any(ByteBuff.class),
785      Mockito.anyLong());
786
787    // create an bucket allocator.
788    long availableSpace = 1024 * 1024 * 1024L;
789    BucketAllocator allocator = new BucketAllocator(availableSpace, null);
790
791    BlockCacheKey key = new BlockCacheKey("dummy", 1L);
792    RAMQueueEntry re = new RAMQueueEntry(key, block, 1, true, false);
793
794    Assert.assertEquals(0, allocator.getUsedSize());
795    try {
796      re.writeToCache(ioEngine, allocator, null, null,
797        ByteBuffer.allocate(HFileBlock.BLOCK_METADATA_SPACE));
798      Assert.fail();
799    } catch (Exception e) {
800    }
801    Assert.assertEquals(0, allocator.getUsedSize());
802  }
803
804  /**
805   * This test is for HBASE-26295, {@link BucketEntry} which is restored from a persistence file
806   * could not be freed even if corresponding {@link HFileBlock} is evicted from
807   * {@link BucketCache}.
808   */
809  @Test
810  public void testFreeBucketEntryRestoredFromFile() throws Exception {
811    BucketCache bucketCache = null;
812    try {
813      final Path dataTestDir = createAndGetTestDir();
814
815      String ioEngineName = "file:" + dataTestDir + "/bucketNoRecycler.cache";
816      String persistencePath = dataTestDir + "/bucketNoRecycler.persistence";
817
818      bucketCache = new BucketCache(ioEngineName, capacitySize, constructedBlockSize,
819        constructedBlockSizes, writeThreads, writerQLen, persistencePath);
820      assertTrue(bucketCache.waitForCacheInitialization(10000));
821      long usedByteSize = bucketCache.getAllocator().getUsedSize();
822      assertEquals(0, usedByteSize);
823
824      HFileBlockPair[] hfileBlockPairs =
825        CacheTestUtils.generateHFileBlocks(constructedBlockSize, 1);
826      // Add blocks
827      for (HFileBlockPair hfileBlockPair : hfileBlockPairs) {
828        bucketCache.cacheBlock(hfileBlockPair.getBlockName(), hfileBlockPair.getBlock());
829      }
830
831      for (HFileBlockPair hfileBlockPair : hfileBlockPairs) {
832        cacheAndWaitUntilFlushedToBucket(bucketCache, hfileBlockPair.getBlockName(),
833          hfileBlockPair.getBlock(), false);
834      }
835      usedByteSize = bucketCache.getAllocator().getUsedSize();
836      assertNotEquals(0, usedByteSize);
837      // persist cache to file
838      bucketCache.shutdown();
839      assertTrue(new File(persistencePath).exists());
840
841      // restore cache from file
842      bucketCache = new BucketCache(ioEngineName, capacitySize, constructedBlockSize,
843        constructedBlockSizes, writeThreads, writerQLen, persistencePath);
844      assertTrue(bucketCache.waitForCacheInitialization(10000));
845      assertEquals(usedByteSize, bucketCache.getAllocator().getUsedSize());
846
847      for (HFileBlockPair hfileBlockPair : hfileBlockPairs) {
848        BlockCacheKey blockCacheKey = hfileBlockPair.getBlockName();
849        bucketCache.evictBlock(blockCacheKey);
850      }
851      assertEquals(0, bucketCache.getAllocator().getUsedSize());
852      assertEquals(0, bucketCache.backingMap.size());
853    } finally {
854      bucketCache.shutdown();
855      HBASE_TESTING_UTILITY.cleanupTestDir();
856    }
857  }
858
859  @Test
860  public void testBlockAdditionWaitWhenCache() throws Exception {
861    BucketCache bucketCache = null;
862    try {
863      final Path dataTestDir = createAndGetTestDir();
864
865      String ioEngineName = "file:" + dataTestDir + "/bucketNoRecycler.cache";
866      String persistencePath = dataTestDir + "/bucketNoRecycler.persistence";
867
868      bucketCache = new BucketCache(ioEngineName, capacitySize, constructedBlockSize,
869        constructedBlockSizes, 1, 1, persistencePath);
870      assertTrue(bucketCache.waitForCacheInitialization(10000));
871      long usedByteSize = bucketCache.getAllocator().getUsedSize();
872      assertEquals(0, usedByteSize);
873
874      HFileBlockPair[] hfileBlockPairs =
875        CacheTestUtils.generateHFileBlocks(constructedBlockSize, 10);
876      // Add blocks
877      for (HFileBlockPair hfileBlockPair : hfileBlockPairs) {
878        bucketCache.cacheBlock(hfileBlockPair.getBlockName(), hfileBlockPair.getBlock(), false,
879          true);
880      }
881
882      // Max wait for 10 seconds.
883      long timeout = 10000;
884      // Wait for blocks size to match the number of blocks.
885      while (bucketCache.backingMap.size() != 10) {
886        if (timeout <= 0) break;
887        Threads.sleep(100);
888        timeout -= 100;
889      }
890      for (HFileBlockPair hfileBlockPair : hfileBlockPairs) {
891        assertTrue(bucketCache.backingMap.containsKey(hfileBlockPair.getBlockName()));
892      }
893      usedByteSize = bucketCache.getAllocator().getUsedSize();
894      assertNotEquals(0, usedByteSize);
895      // persist cache to file
896      bucketCache.shutdown();
897      assertTrue(new File(persistencePath).exists());
898
899      // restore cache from file
900      bucketCache = new BucketCache(ioEngineName, capacitySize, constructedBlockSize,
901        constructedBlockSizes, writeThreads, writerQLen, persistencePath);
902      assertTrue(bucketCache.waitForCacheInitialization(10000));
903      assertEquals(usedByteSize, bucketCache.getAllocator().getUsedSize());
904
905      for (HFileBlockPair hfileBlockPair : hfileBlockPairs) {
906        BlockCacheKey blockCacheKey = hfileBlockPair.getBlockName();
907        bucketCache.evictBlock(blockCacheKey);
908      }
909      assertEquals(0, bucketCache.getAllocator().getUsedSize());
910      assertEquals(0, bucketCache.backingMap.size());
911    } finally {
912      if (bucketCache != null) {
913        bucketCache.shutdown();
914      }
915      HBASE_TESTING_UTILITY.cleanupTestDir();
916    }
917  }
918
919  @Test
920  public void testNotifyFileCachingCompletedSuccess() throws Exception {
921    BucketCache bucketCache = null;
922    try {
923      Path filePath =
924        new Path(HBASE_TESTING_UTILITY.getDataTestDir(), "testNotifyFileCachingCompletedSuccess");
925      bucketCache = testNotifyFileCachingCompletedForTenBlocks(filePath, 10);
926      if (bucketCache.getStats().getFailedInserts() > 0) {
927        LOG.info("There were {} fail inserts, "
928          + "will assert if total blocks in backingMap equals (10 - failInserts) "
929          + "and file isn't listed as fully cached.", bucketCache.getStats().getFailedInserts());
930        assertEquals(10 - bucketCache.getStats().getFailedInserts(), bucketCache.backingMap.size());
931        assertFalse(bucketCache.fullyCachedFiles.containsKey(filePath.getName()));
932      } else {
933        assertTrue(bucketCache.fullyCachedFiles.containsKey(filePath.getName()));
934      }
935    } finally {
936      if (bucketCache != null) {
937        bucketCache.shutdown();
938      }
939      HBASE_TESTING_UTILITY.cleanupTestDir();
940    }
941  }
942
943  @Test
944  public void testNotifyFileCachingCompletedNotAllCached() throws Exception {
945    BucketCache bucketCache = null;
946    try {
947      Path filePath = new Path(HBASE_TESTING_UTILITY.getDataTestDir(),
948        "testNotifyFileCachingCompletedNotAllCached");
949      // Deliberately passing more blocks than we have created to test that
950      // notifyFileCachingCompleted will not consider the file fully cached
951      bucketCache = testNotifyFileCachingCompletedForTenBlocks(filePath, 12);
952      assertFalse(bucketCache.fullyCachedFiles.containsKey(filePath.getName()));
953    } finally {
954      if (bucketCache != null) {
955        bucketCache.shutdown();
956      }
957      HBASE_TESTING_UTILITY.cleanupTestDir();
958    }
959  }
960
961  private BucketCache testNotifyFileCachingCompletedForTenBlocks(Path filePath,
962    int totalBlocksToCheck) throws Exception {
963    final Path dataTestDir = createAndGetTestDir();
964    String ioEngineName = "file:" + dataTestDir + "/bucketNoRecycler.cache";
965    BucketCache bucketCache = new BucketCache(ioEngineName, capacitySize, constructedBlockSize,
966      constructedBlockSizes, 1, 1, null);
967    assertTrue(bucketCache.waitForCacheInitialization(10000));
968    long usedByteSize = bucketCache.getAllocator().getUsedSize();
969    assertEquals(0, usedByteSize);
970    HFileBlockPair[] hfileBlockPairs =
971      CacheTestUtils.generateBlocksForPath(constructedBlockSize, 10, filePath);
972    // Add blocks
973    for (HFileBlockPair hfileBlockPair : hfileBlockPairs) {
974      bucketCache.cacheBlock(hfileBlockPair.getBlockName(), hfileBlockPair.getBlock(), false, true);
975    }
976    bucketCache.notifyFileCachingCompleted(filePath, totalBlocksToCheck, totalBlocksToCheck,
977      totalBlocksToCheck * constructedBlockSize);
978    return bucketCache;
979  }
980
981  @Test
982  public void testEvictOrphansOutOfGracePeriod() throws Exception {
983    BucketCache bucketCache = testEvictOrphans(0);
984    assertEquals(10, bucketCache.getBackingMap().size());
985    assertEquals(0, bucketCache.blocksByHFile.stream()
986      .filter(key -> key.getHfileName().equals("testEvictOrphans-orphan")).count());
987  }
988
989  @Test
990  public void testEvictOrphansWithinGracePeriod() throws Exception {
991    BucketCache bucketCache = testEvictOrphans(60 * 60 * 1000L);
992    assertEquals(18, bucketCache.getBackingMap().size());
993    assertTrue(bucketCache.blocksByHFile.stream()
994      .filter(key -> key.getHfileName().equals("testEvictOrphans-orphan")).count() > 0);
995  }
996
997  private BucketCache testEvictOrphans(long orphanEvictionGracePeriod) throws Exception {
998    Path validFile = new Path(HBASE_TESTING_UTILITY.getDataTestDir(), "testEvictOrphans-valid");
999    Path orphanFile = new Path(HBASE_TESTING_UTILITY.getDataTestDir(), "testEvictOrphans-orphan");
1000    Map<String, HRegion> onlineRegions = new HashMap<>();
1001    List<HStore> stores = new ArrayList<>();
1002    Collection<HStoreFile> storeFiles = new ArrayList<>();
1003    HRegion mockedRegion = mock(HRegion.class);
1004    HStore mockedStore = mock(HStore.class);
1005    HStoreFile mockedStoreFile = mock(HStoreFile.class);
1006    when(mockedStoreFile.getPath()).thenReturn(validFile);
1007    storeFiles.add(mockedStoreFile);
1008    when(mockedStore.getStorefiles()).thenReturn(storeFiles);
1009    stores.add(mockedStore);
1010    when(mockedRegion.getStores()).thenReturn(stores);
1011    onlineRegions.put("mocked_region", mockedRegion);
1012    HBASE_TESTING_UTILITY.getConfiguration().setDouble(MIN_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, 0.99);
1013    HBASE_TESTING_UTILITY.getConfiguration().setDouble(ACCEPT_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, 1);
1014    HBASE_TESTING_UTILITY.getConfiguration().setDouble(EXTRA_FREE_FACTOR_CONFIG_NAME, 0.01);
1015    HBASE_TESTING_UTILITY.getConfiguration().setLong(BLOCK_ORPHAN_GRACE_PERIOD,
1016      orphanEvictionGracePeriod);
1017    BucketCache bucketCache = new BucketCache(ioEngineName, (constructedBlockSize + 1024) * 21,
1018      constructedBlockSize, new int[] { constructedBlockSize + 1024 }, 1, 1, null, 60 * 1000,
1019      HBASE_TESTING_UTILITY.getConfiguration(), onlineRegions);
1020    HFileBlockPair[] validBlockPairs =
1021      CacheTestUtils.generateBlocksForPath(constructedBlockSize, 10, validFile);
1022    HFileBlockPair[] orphanBlockPairs =
1023      CacheTestUtils.generateBlocksForPath(constructedBlockSize, 10, orphanFile);
1024    for (HFileBlockPair pair : validBlockPairs) {
1025      bucketCache.cacheBlockWithWait(pair.getBlockName(), pair.getBlock(), false, true);
1026    }
1027    waitUntilAllFlushedToBucket(bucketCache);
1028    assertEquals(10, bucketCache.getBackingMap().size());
1029    bucketCache.freeSpace("test");
1030    assertEquals(10, bucketCache.getBackingMap().size());
1031    for (HFileBlockPair pair : orphanBlockPairs) {
1032      bucketCache.cacheBlockWithWait(pair.getBlockName(), pair.getBlock(), false, true);
1033    }
1034    waitUntilAllFlushedToBucket(bucketCache);
1035    assertEquals(20, bucketCache.getBackingMap().size());
1036    bucketCache.freeSpace("test");
1037    return bucketCache;
1038  }
1039}
